oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-09-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 24, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer - although Ernest Tubb was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Hawkshaw Hawkins, and regular performers Rod Brasfield with Uncle Cyp, Del Wood, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Rod Brasfield; Hawkshaw Hawkins; Del Wood; Uncle Cyp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- Live Fast, Love Hard, Die Young (Faron Young) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Faron Young) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- How Could Anything So Pretty (Be So Doggone Mean) (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Faron Young talks -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- God Bless God (Faron Young) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Prince Albert jingle (Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Del Wood -- Twelfth Street Rag (Del Wood) -- Faron Young introduces Uncle Cyp -- Comedy routine (Uncle Cyp, Faron Young, Rod Brasfield) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Young, Faron; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Brasfield, Laurence Lemarr, 1898-1966; Hawkins, Hawkshaw, 1921-1963
